author: Special Correspondent
text:
Vehicles and movable properties owned by defunct emu companies on Thursday fetched Rs. 83.74 lakh for the Revenue Department, that conducted auction on Thursday as directed by the special court for the Tamil Nadu Protection of Interests of Depositors (in Financial establishments) Act, Coimbatore.

Twenty two four-wheelers and 14 two-wheelers were auctioned for Rs. 79.65 lakh and five items of furniture for Rs. 4.09 lakh, District Revenue Officer R. Satheesh said. Three four-wheelers and one office furniture item could not be auctioned.

While there were no takers for the birds, auction of vehicles always attracted prospective buyers in large numbers.

During a similar auction conducted during November 2013, seven four-wheelers that attracted over 200 bidders were sold for a little over Rs. 30 lakh.

The Economic Offences Wing had received complaints from 9439 persons during 2013 stating that the companies had defaulted on payment after operating for six years.

The companies had subsequently abandoned about 12,000 birds several of which had died and the rest had to be sold at throwaway prices.
title: Auction of vehicles, furniture fetch Rs. 83.74 lakh
